resources.string: Who said, \"No one can make you feel insecure without your consent\"?
True or false: Women were given the right to vote in the US in 1919.
___________ conducted pioneer research in radiation, the first woman to win a Nobel Prize and the first person to win two Nobel Prizes
She was the first female astronaut in the US.
She was the first computer programmer.
Select the following whom where or are Supreme Court Justices.

Eleanor Roosevelt was a multifaceted woman. She was a first lady and wife to Franklin Roosevelt. She was also a politician, diplomat and an author. Her quote \"No one can make you feel insecure without your consent\" is one of her most famous quotes.
The United States granted women the right to vote in the year 1920.

Sally Kristen Ride became the first American woman to fly in space. She worked for NASA from 1977 to 1987. Afterwards, she taught at the University of California. She looked for ways to educated girls about science and mathematics up until her passing in 2012.

Ada Lovelace is sometimes called the "first computer scientist" after she wrote a report on Babbage\'s machine. She said that the device could be used to handle letters, symbols as well as repeat a series of instructions(which is known as looping).

Ginsburg, O\'Connor and Sotomayor are/were Supreme Court judges. O\'Connor was the first woman to hold this title and took the oath of office in 1981 and retired in 2006. Ginsburg was appointed a Supreme Court Justice by Bill Clinton in 1993.. Sotomayor has been serving since 2009 and is the first Supreme Court Justice to be Hispanic and Latina.
